title: SOE Syllabus: Lessons in Ungentlemanly Warfare, World War II
description: As the regular forces rebuilt after their escape from Dunkirk, Britain began striking back at Nazi Germany through a small number of strategically placed spies and saboteurs, the Special Operations Executive. Britain's Public Record Office now reveals much new information, particularly about the training of agents. This heavily illustrated work includes actual training manuals used during World War II.
author: Denis Rigden
